pros: Very very flexible job. Make your own hours.
cons: Having to use your own vehicle and pay is inconsistent

pros: What OLV Human Services provides for the community is truly beautiful and deeply needed. A lot of the employees have big hearts to help out each other as well as the various people groups that they serve. The benefits are fantastic. They truly care about finding ways to support employees.
cons: After leadership changes, it became clear that upper management only maintained and/or promoted those who would not question their decisions even to the detriment of the programs and employees. I witnessed upper leadership fire an amazing leader who proved themselves as a highly effective and competent manager without cause.

pros: Great place to work! Couldn’t ask for a better support system!
cons: Staffing is an issue. Rate adjustments are needed but difficult to obtain.

pros: Benefits, training, mission & values
cons: Culture, administration, lack of communication

pros: Great Benefits package, great work life balance in my department
cons: People making decisions have no clue how things are actually run.

pros: work life balance, co workers
cons: low level of pay and no increases

job_title: Behavior Health Technician in Buffalo, NY
pros: Wage being at least 20+
cons: Poorly managed and weekly mandation even for students

pros: Pros are being able to help high school aged kids and truly being there for them in rough times. Other than helping kids there are absolutely no pros to this job.
cons: The supervisor and all management don’t care. The staff have their own groups that aren’t welcoming to new employees. It’s extremely hard to establish yourself. There’s adult drama in a high school setting. There is absolutely no support in times of crisis. Everything you do is wrong , it’s always a double edged sword. And if you made the wrong decision your supervisor will ignore you like a child because they don’t want to give you constructive criticism. Supervisors will also throw you under the bus and tell you that you can’t speak to other staff members about what’s happened. They wonder why there’s a LARGE turnaround rate. Cannot express how many CONS there are.

job_title: School Age Educator in Lackawanna, NY
pros: Family-Focused, Great co-workers, Teachers work their hardest, great students
cons:
Executive Leadership is going through a change, a little chaotic
Needs help with technology, is behind the time, but understanding it is an agency, not a district

job_title: Special Education Teacher in Buffalo, NY
pros: If you are willing to make your own curriculum, work with a constantly changing population of students, then you will find success working for Our Lady Victory.
cons:
It can be frustrating teaching material to students of wildly varying grade levels. At juvenile detention, the population of students is constantly changing, including those who are already graduated.

There is little to no upward mobility, so it is a good place to start your career, but not to stay.

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Lackawanna, NY
pros: Sign on bonus is good.
cons: They treat you like your their property, over work you but don’t pay enough. Have you travel far to other places after being mandated. To work here you need to not have a family or a life.

job_title: Financial Analyst in West Seneca, NY
pros: There are some Nice people
cons: Some applications technologies and procedures feel Outdated

pros: The kids are wonderful to work with

Opportunities to advance.

job_title: Speech Language Pathologist in Buffalo, NY

pros: I loved working for BVS. My supervisors were very helpful, supportive and flexible anytime you need them. The staff are great! Everyone is willing to teach, learn and help one another.
cons: You have to be open-minded to the population of clients. Training will teach you the basic knowledge but being on the floor is totally different. Ask for help when you need it.

job_title: Behavior Support Clinician in Buffalo, NY
pros: The pto that the education team receives is pretty good.
cons: Scheduling. Mandating policy. Employees attitudes.

review_title: 3 Stars for Keeping Me During Covid
job_title: Behavior Support Technician in Lackawanna, NY
pros: I will give them credit here for not cutting a lot of positions during COVID-19 that were basically unnecessary, such as my position as a Behavior Tech for the school (as schools were closed for many months).
cons: Organizational culture is toxic. This is not dramatic or over exaggerated, there needs to be serious reform within the company with regard to standards and professionalism. People who are promoted/put into management positions are often friends with the people doing the interviews, and often employees with more qualifications and more time with the company are overlooked. Many positions require only a HS diploma or GED. This is fine, however the company lacks the appropriate amount/kinds of training needed to develop competent employees that come into this field with zero experience.

review_title: Work here to get experience, then move on.
job_title: Direct Support Proferssional in Lackawanna, NY
pros: The residents are fun to work with (you'd hate to leave them) and the staff are mostly fine and dedicated. House managers are all right, some are nice and hardworking.
cons: The people who run the agency should be removed and replaced. They are clueless about handling and managing staff and making them feel wanted and needed (the "Sanctuary Model" notwithstanding, it is merely feel-good propaganda.)

job_title: Pre School Aide in Lackawanna, NY
pros: When I started over 2 years ago I had to chase down to get any information about start dates,and training. There is no real training.
cons: The staff in the preschool are always on cell phones. The younger people there are flirting with the fathers of the children. People like the last principal worked there even though they got arrested for DWIs. It is the fact that they don't give any training for behaviors but have behavior rooms is concerning, when they are asked for a behavior plan you get nothing, they aren't trained in disabilities so the teachers aren't providing the best service .The teacher in my room was more concerned with her heroine addicted baby daddy than the kids.

review_title: I had a very rewarding and positive learning experience at Baker Victory Services.
job_title: Human Resources Generalist in Lackawanna, NY
pros: I enjoyed being part of an organization that genuinely cared about individuals and families that we served while providing good quality care. Also, working for an agency that take pride in helping employees grow and advance their careers was fulfilling to me.
cons: The inability to take some of great ideas from frontline and use it to increase employee engagement across the agency.

review_title: I love my job at Baker Victory Services
job_title: Direct Support Professional in Buffalo, NY
pros: There are so many pro's to working at Baker Victory Services.  I love what I do and the people I serve.  You get paid to do a lot of things you enjoy.
cons: I just wish there was more pay and a higher frequency of raises.  The state cut funding drastically and that put a slight halt to raises with the company. Some houses were sold.

review_title: A once great organization which is fading fast.
pros: Great experience at the direct care level. Was a great organization under the previous CEO. They preach open communication but are not prepared to follow up when concerns are brought forward.
cons: Some of the leaders lack integrity. Need to watch your back. Honesty & integrity don't play well here. It's all about who you know, and who you can manipulate.

pros: I love my co workers and the kids.
